intro: Hibbertia ovata var. typica, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in racemes and bloom from late winter to spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is typically found in heathlands and open forests. It is a member of the family Dilleniaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Hibbertia ovata var. typica is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
